structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases
Conduct Of Public Officials And Employees

law.catch_line: Municipal Employees; Financial Interest In Contracts; Holding One Or More Elected Positions

text.section: A municipal employee who has a financial interest, directly or indirectly, in a contract made by a municipal agency of the same city or town, in which the city or town is an interested party of which financial interest he has knowledge or has reason to know, shall be punished by a fine of not more than $10,000, or by imprisonment in the state prison for not more than 5 years, or in a jail or house of correction for not more than 2 1/2 years, or both.
